question: who is the longest serving manager in manchester united history
api_result: The longest-serving manager in Manchester United history is Sir Alex Ferguson. He managed the club from November 6, 1986, until his retirement on May 19, 2013, spanning nearly 27 years. During his tenure, Ferguson achieved significant success, including 13 Premier League titles, 5 FA Cups, and 2 UEFA Champions League titles, among other honors. His impact on the club and football in general is widely recognized.
